text: I believe that words are strong, that they can overwhelm what we fear when fear seems more awful than life is good.
author: Andrew Solomon

text: Sometimes when it looks like I'm deep in thought I'm just trying not to have a conversation with people.
author: Marquis de Sade

text: She just smiled, said that she loved books more than anything, and started telling him excitedly what each of the ones in her lap was about. And Ove realised that he wanted to hear her talking about the things she loved for the rest of his life.
author: Fredrick Backman

text: Everyone has their own ways of expression. I believe we all have a lot to say, but finding ways to say it is more than half the battle.
author: Chriss Jami

text: Good communication is as stimulating as black coffee and just as hard to sleep after.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

text: The art of conversation is the art of hearing as well as of being heard.
author: William Hazlitt

text: I never desire to converse with a man who has written more than he has read.
author: Samuel Johnson

text: Women speak because they wish to speak, whereas a man speaks only when driven to speak by something outside himself-like, for instance, he can't find any clean socks.
author: Jean Kerr

text: Conversation. What is it? A Mystery! It's the art of never seeming bored, of touching everything with interest, of pleasing with trifles, of being fascinating with nothing at all.
author: Guy de Maupassant

text: A conversation is a dialogue, not a monologue. That's why there are so few good conversations: due to scarcity, two intelligent talkers seldom meet.
author: Truman Capote
